oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: WHN Guest Disc Jockey: The Crickets - 1979-08-01
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from the WHN radio network. The recording is of the Crickets (musical group) members: Joe B. Mauldin, Jerry Allison and Sonny Curtis performance as disc jockeys for WHN. The recording is from August 01, 1979.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: The Crickets
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) When You're in Love With a Beautiful Woman [excerpt] (Dr. Hook) -- (00:16) WHN radio spot introducing Joe B. Mauldin, Jerry Allison, and Sonny Curtis -- (00:27) Love is All Around (Troggs) -- (02:42) Curtis reflects on writing ""Love is All Around"" for Mary Tyler Moore -- (03:17) That'll be the Day (Buddy Holly and The Crickets) -- (05:45) Joe B. Mauldin reflects on writing ""That'll be the Day"" with Owen Bradley -- (06:42) Walk Right Back (Anne Murray) -- (09:14) Curtis reflects on writing ""Walk Right Back"" while being in the army -- (10:00) Oh Boy (Buddy Holly and The Crickets) -- (12:06) The Crickets perform a WHN and New York City Department of Transportation commercial spot -- (12:31) An unidentified host performs a Bronx Zoo commercial spot -- (13:12) Mauldin performs a Bronx Zoo commercial spot -- (13:15) Perdue Farms commercial spot hosted by Frank Perdue -- (14:43) I Fought the Law (The Bobby Fuller Four) -- (17:00) The Crickets reflect on being a part of a film -- (18:13) Maybe Baby (The Crickets) -- (20:14) Curtis performs a weather radio spot -- (20:53) Amanda (Waylon Jennings) -- (23:43) The Crickets reflect on their friend Waylon Jennings -- (24:28) Sears commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (25:00) Resin Vacuum commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (25:35) WHN Listener's Choice Awards radio spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (25:43) If I Said You Had a Beautiful Body [excerpt] (Bellamy Brothers) -- (25:51) You Didn't Bring Me Flowers [excerpt] (Barbara Streisand and Neil Diamond) -- (25:57) Lying in Love With You [excerpt] (Jim Ed Brown and Helen Cornelius) -- (26:16) The Crickets perform a WHN Listener's Choice Awards radio spot and introduce ""Ghost Riders in the Sky"" -- (26:50) Ghost Riders in the Sky (Johnny Cash) -- (30:24) Mauldin performs a WHN radio spot -- (30:29) Mauldin reflects on the inspiration of ""Peggy Sue"" -- (31:03) Peggy Sue (Buddy Holly and The Crickets) -- (33:35) Allison performs a WHN radio spot about Jim Reeves -- (34:43) Don't Let Me Cross Over (Jim Reeves) -- (37:06) Howard Savings Bank commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (38:13) Hillshire Farms commercial spot hosted by Curtis -- (39:21) WHN Listener's Choice Awards radio spot hosted by Allison -- (39:49) Allison introduces ""Think it Over"" -- (40:01) Think it Over (Buddy Holly and the Crickets) -- (41:46) Elvis Presley WHN radio spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (42:16) Marty Lacker reflects on the excitement of recording Presley -- (43:14) In the Ghetto (Elvis Presley) -- (45:57) The Crickets reflect on Presley visiting Texas; additionally, the Crickets reflect on the time they picked on Marty Robbins -- (47:38) All Around Cowboy (Marty Robbins) -- (50:38) Curtis praises Robbins' charisma and reflects on his time with Holly -- (51:34) It's So Easy (Buddy Holly and The Crickets) -- (53:47) An unidentified host breaks from the show to discuss Arthur Ash and other local news -- (55:08) Midtown traffic condition commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (56:24) AMP commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (57:20) WHN Listener's Choice Awards radio spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (57:34) Simple Little Words (Cristy Lane) -- (1:00:49) The Crickets reflect on the different version of ""That'll be the Day"" they were about to play -- (1:01:55) That'll be the Day (Buddy Holly and the Crickets) -- (1:04:08) You're the Only One (Dolly Parton)
